objenome.goal

Class SumOfError<I,O>

  • java.lang.Object
    • objenome.solver.evolve.AbstractFitnessFunction<TypedOrganism>
      • objenome.goal.TypedFitnessFunction
        • objenome.goal.SumOfError<I,O>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Listener<ConfigEvent>, FitnessFunction<TypedOrganism>, GPContainer.GPContainerAware

    public class SumOfError<I,O>
extends TypedFitnessFunction
implements Listener<ConfigEvent>, GPContainer.GPContainerAware
    A fitness function for STGPIndividuals that calculates and assigns DoubleFitness.Minimise scores. The fitness scores are calculated by executing the program for each of the provided sets of inputs. The difference between the value returned by the program and the expected outputs supplied is summed to give the fitness value. When using this fitness function the INPUT_VARIABLES, TypedFitnessFunction.INPUT_VALUE_SETS and #EXPECTED_OUTPUTS config options must be set, or the same values set using the mutator methods provided. The length of the INPUT_VALUE_SETS array should match the length of the EXPECTED_OUTPUTS array and the number of values in each set should match the length of the INPUT_VARIABLES array. If the program returns NaN for any of the input sets then a fitness score of NaN is assigned by default, although this can be changed by overriding the nanFitnessScore method.
    Since:
    2.0

      • SumOfError

        public SumOfError(boolean autoConfig)
        Constructs a SumOfError fitness function with control parameters initially loaded from the config. If the autoConfig argument is set to true then the configuration will be automatically updated when the config is modified.
        Parameters:
        autoConfig - whether this operator should automatically update its configuration settings from the config

    • Method Detail

      • setConfig

        public void setConfig(GPContainer config)
        Sets up this operator with the appropriate configuration settings. This method is called whenever a ConfigEvent occurs for a change in any of the following configuration parameters:
        • INPUT_VARIABLES
        • TypedFitnessFunction.INPUT_VALUE_SETS
        • #EXPECTED_OUTPUTS
        Specified by:
        setConfig in interface GPContainer.GPContainerAware

        Specified by:
        onEvent in interface Listener<ConfigEvent>
        Parameters:
        event - the fired event object.

      • evaluate

        public DoubleFitness.Minimize evaluate(Population population,
                                       TypedOrganism individual)
        Calculates the fitness of the given individual. This fitness function only operates on STGPIndividuals with a Double data-type. The fitness returned will be an instance of DoubleFitness.Minimise. The fitness score is calculated as the sum of the difference between the expected outputs and the actual outputs, for each set of inputs.
        Specified by:
        evaluate in class AbstractFitnessFunction<TypedOrganism>
        Parameters:
        individual - the individual to evaluate the fitness of
        Returns:
        the fitness of the given individual
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the individual is not an STGPIndividual or the individual's data-type is not Double.

      • nanFitnessScore

        protected java.lang.Double nanFitnessScore()
        Returns the value to be used when an individual returns a NaN value. The default value is Double.NaN.
        Returns:
        the value to return when an individual returns a NaN value

      • getInputVariables

        public Variable[] getInputVariables()
        Gets the input variables that are currently set
        Returns:
        the current input variables

      • setInputVariables

        public void setInputVariables(Variable[] inputVariables)
        Sets the input variables. These should be the variables used in the terminal set, which will have the input values assigned to them. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the INPUT_VARIABLES configuration setting on the next config event.
        Parameters:
        inputVariables - the input variables
